title: If I visit the grave of someone I used to be, is that me in the grave or merely a shell that I inhabited for a while? Should I mourn that person's demise or simply view the person as a temporary vessel? - Quora

response.answer_text: Funny question. And fun… I was researching someone that I recalled - a previous lifetime that I remembered while filming a deep hypnosis session, where I remembered being a specific person. I had his name, the city he was in, the life he led, and the dates he led them. I was startled to find this fellow in the historical records (as reported in “Architecture of the Afterlife” and even more startled to find that they had “put his body on display.” In doing this research, I hear it often; we don’t bring all of our conscious energy to a lifetime. So we aren’t “100% that person” - (even though it feels that we are while here) and that our conscious energy is a mix of “all of our lifetimes.” So if one can think of a juice drink that has all kinds of fruit - and its blended, and then a portion of it is poured into a lifetime, it might help understand the process. Then when that lifetime is over, that “one third” of our conscious energy returns the pitcher of fruit juice - bringing all the memories and experiences of that lifetime and then blending it with the others. So even if we find or discover someone’s tomb or gravestone that we recall being - a soldier in the Civil War for example, we aren’t completely that person either. We are who we are - but we are an amalgamation of everyone we’ve been. At least that’s what the research shows. My two cents.

Are you talking about visiting your past life personality’s grave? How cool is that! - to be able to find the grave and the records of your past life. This is quite rare - most regression clients never get the second name or the name of the town or any details allowing them to find find the records of this personality. Plus you can’t find any records before the industrial age, or tribal lives…Clients get the life story, the emotions, the lessons, and skills, but hardly ever the full name and place to verify the existence of this person. This is a fun material for books or Youtube videos. You should go with your own feelings. Did they die young and were not able to fulfill the life plan? In this case, maybe you should release all the feelings related to the untimely death, as you are still holding them deep inside yourself… Or did they die peacefully surrounded by family and were happy to leave the worn-out body? What was their last thought? What happened after they left the body? How do you relate to their life? What do you share? What do you resent about them? What skills or character traits you want to keep from that life? What spiritual lessons did you learn? After all - you and they are related ‘by the spirit” - you are not exactly them in a new body, but you share the essence, the immortal soul. Different people have different relationships with their past life personalities - some adore them and spend lots of time researching them, writing books about them, starting Facebook pages on their name, channeling them, etc. (this usually happens when the PL personality was more or less famous). Others befriend them as ‘imaginary friends”. A powerful and wise past life personality can be your Spirit Guide in specific tasks like healing, art, writing, meditation, etc. If you do not relate to them very much - you can just let it go, and look at that personality as just one of many ‘costumes” your soul wore on Earth.
